title: Iconic TV Shows of the 50s & 60s
description: From I Love Lucy to The Twilight Zone — test your knowledge of television's most beloved early shows!

questions.question: On 'I Love Lucy,' what was the name of the nightclub where Ricky Ricardo performed?
questions.explanation: Ricky Ricardo performed at the Tropicana Club (later renamed Club Babalu in some episodes). Desi Arnaz's real-life musical talent made the performances authentic.

questions.question: Which show famously introduced rock 'n' roll acts, comedians, and variety performers to a Sunday night audience?
questions.explanation: The Ed Sullivan Show ran from 1948 to 1971, showcasing everyone from Elvis Presley and the Beatles to the cast of the Broadway show 'Oliver!'

questions.question: What was the name of the sheriff in the fictional town of Mayberry, North Carolina?
questions.explanation: Andy Griffith starred as the wise and folksy Sheriff Andy Taylor on The Andy Griffith Show (1960-1968). The show is still beloved for its small-town warmth.

questions.question: Which sci-fi anthology series, hosted by Rod Serling, explored strange and supernatural stories?
questions.explanation: The Twilight Zone ran from 1959 to 1964, with Rod Serling writing or co-writing 92 of the 156 episodes. Its twist endings became legendary.

questions.question: Which 1950s Western TV show featured Marshal Matt Dillon keeping order in Dodge City?
questions.explanation: Gunsmoke ran for 20 seasons from 1955 to 1975, making it one of the longest-running primetime live-action series in American television history.

questions.question: Who played the bumbling deputy Barney Fife on 'The Andy Griffith Show'?
questions.explanation: Don Knotts won five Emmy Awards for his portrayal of the lovable but inept Barney Fife, making him one of the most awarded comedy actors of the era.

questions.question: What groundbreaking 1960s TV show featured an interracial cast aboard the USS Enterprise?
options: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
questions.explanation: Star Trek, created by Gene Roddenberry, debuted in 1966 and featured one of TV's first interracial casts, including the first interracial kiss on American television.

questions.question: Which family sitcom featured a housekeeper named Hazel Burke?
questions.explanation: Shirley Booth starred as the opinionated but lovable maid Hazel from 1961 to 1966, winning two Emmy Awards for the role.

questions.question: On 'The Honeymooners,' what was Ralph Kramden's job?
questions.explanation: Jackie Gleason's Ralph Kramden drove a bus for the Gotham Bus Company. The show, set in a modest Brooklyn apartment, ran as a series in 1955-56.

questions.question: Which 1960s sitcom featured a genie discovered by an astronaut?
questions.explanation: I Dream of Jeannie starred Barbara Eden as a 2,000-year-old genie and Larry Hagman as astronaut Tony Nelson. It ran from 1965 to 1970.

questions.question: What classic TV show featured the Ricardo and Mertz families as neighbors?
options: The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet
questions.explanation: Fred and Ethel Mertz, played by William Frawley and Vivian Vance, were the Ricardos' landlords and best friends on I Love Lucy.

questions.question: Which TV Western, set on the Ponderosa ranch, featured the Cartwright family?
questions.explanation: Bonanza aired from 1959 to 1973 and was one of the first series broadcast in color. The Cartwright family — Ben, Adam, Hoss, and Little Joe — became household names.

questions.question: Who hosted the panel show 'What's My Line?' for its entire CBS run from 1950 to 1967?
questions.explanation: John Daly moderated What's My Line? for all 17 years of its original run. Panelists like Dorothy Kilgallen and Bennett Cerf became celebrities in their own right.

questions.question: Which 1960s spy spoof TV series starred Don Adams as a bumbling secret agent?
questions.explanation: Get Smart, created by Mel Brooks and Buck Henry, ran from 1965 to 1970. Maxwell Smart's shoe phone and the catchphrase 'Would you believe...' became iconic.

questions.question: Which comedian hosted a pioneering TV variety show from 1948 to 1956, earning the nickname 'Mr. Television'?
questions.explanation: Milton Berle's Texaco Star Theater was so popular that it's credited with driving early television sales. Restaurants and movie theaters reportedly emptied on Tuesday nights.
